oai_dc:dc.dc:title: TOWARDS A PRACTICAL APPLICATION OF NUMERICAL MODELS TO PREDICT WAVE-STRUCTURE INTERACTION: AN INITIAL VALIDATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: van den Bos, Jeroen
Verhagen, Henk Jan
Zijlema, Marcel
Mellink, Bart
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: rubble-mound structures
porous flow
numerical modeling
VOF modelling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A more detailed understanding of porous flow inside a rubble-mound structure may have potential benefits in breakwater design. Numerical models are expected to be a useful additional research tool in this field, provided that their calculation results can be validated against measurements. This paper presents the results of a systematic effort to validate a set of different numerical models for a strongly simplified model set-up. The results of this effort will be used to select models for a next stage in which the complexity of the model set-up is increased. By means of this step-by-step approach a good insight in the capabilities and limitations of the various models is achieved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; structures.50
